data.title: AfDB okays $200m for Nigeria’s electrification project
data.author: Ambrose Nnaji
data.summary: The African Development Bank Group (AfDB) has approved $200million to boost Nigeria’s electrification project, particularly the off-grid expansion being implemented by the Rural Electrification Agency (REA). According to a reliable source, the project is expected to provide electricity to Nigerian households, medium, small and micro enterprises (MSMEs) and public institutions in a least-cost and timely manner. The project commences soon.
data.content: The African Development Bank Group (AfDB) has approved $200million to boost Nigeria’s electrification project, particularly the off-grid expansion being implemented by the Rural Electrification Agency (REA). According to a reliable source, the project is expected to provide electricity to Nigerian households, medium, small and micro enterprises (MSMEs) and public institutions in a least-cost and timely manner. The project commences soon.

banner.title: Afdb supports Nigeria's electrification project with $200m

data.title: FG ‘ll stop doing business with AMCON debtors — Osinbajo
data.author: Nike Popoola
data.summary: The Vice-President, Prof Yemi Osinbajo, has said the Federal Government will deal decisively with individuals and organizations that made the list of high-profile debtors of the Asset Management Corporation of Nigeria. He said they had made it impossible for the corporation to resolve its outstanding N5tn debt, thereby holding the entire nation to ransom with their bad behavior.
data.content: The Vice-President, Prof Yemi Osinbajo, has said the Federal Government will deal decisively with individuals and organisations that made the list of high-profile debtors of the Asset Management Corporation of Nigeria. He said they had made it impossible for the corporation to resolve its outstanding N5tn debt, thereby holding the entire nation to ransom with their bad behavior.

banner.title: Federal Government moves to recover AMCON's N5tn debt

data.title: Salah enjoys Premier League Golden Boot win
data.author: dejan kalinic
data.summary: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah has won the Premier League Golden Boot once again. Last season, Salah won the Golden Boot scoring 32 goals in 36 games. While he was unable to match that spectacular tally this season, his 22 goals secured him a share of the prize. The trio of Salah, Sadio Mane and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang shared the price with each scoring 22 goals.
data.content: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah has won the Premier League Golden Boot once again. Last season, Salah won the Golden Boot scoring 32 goals in 36 games. While he was unable to match that spectacular tally this season, his 22 goals secured him a share of the prize. The trio of Salah, Sadio Mane and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang shared the price with each scoring 22 goals.

banner.title: Sallah shares Golden Boot win moment with Mane and Aubameyang.
